src:
Xiaomi conferma ufficialmente il chip che animerà Mi CC9 Pro (e quindi anche Mi Note 10)
02 Nov 2019, 17:11 by Edoardo Carlo Ceretti
Il giorno di Mi CC9 Pro si avvicina e Xiaomi non vede l’ora di mostrarlo alla sua schiera di appassionati, tanto da continuare a svelarne dettagli sulla scheda tecnica e le potenzialità che saprà esprimere. L’ultima specifica che è stata appena confermata ufficialmente dal produttore cinese non è da poco: il SoC che ne spingerà le prestazioni.
Come già vociferato negli scorsi giorni, Mi CC9 Pro sarà equipaggiato con lo Snapdragon 730G, ovvero il chip di punta per la fascia medio alta di Qualcomm, con spiccate attitudini al gaming e non solo. Nell’immagine teaser pubblicata su Weibo, si fa riferimento all’incremento prestazionale rispetto alla precedente generazione di SoC e d’altronde di potenza ne avrà bisogno il nuovo Mi CC9 Pro, dovendo anche gestire la penta-cam posteriore da 108 megapixel.
Sebbene la conferma ufficiale non sia mai arrivata, è un segreto di Pulcinella che Mi CC9 Pro sarà la variante cinese del nuovo Mi Note 10, che Xiaomi sta parallelamente pubblicizzando in Europa e che svelerà ufficialmente il 14 novembre prossimo. Per avere la conferma definitiva occorrerà attendere quel giorno, ma possiamo già abituarci all’idea.
Via: Gizchina.com
text:
Johnson declined the invitation of the leader of the Electoral Party for the electoral coalition

02 Nov 2019, 17:03


The British Prime Minister has rejected the request of the leader of the Rexhep party to form an electoral coalition and to refrain from agreeing with Brussels on leaving the EU.


Sunshine News:

British Prime Minister Boris Johnson rejected Nigel Farage's proposal for electoral coalition leader Nigel Farage, saying he would not accept a condition of non-compliance with Brussels' withdrawal from the European Union.
In an interview with BBC News, Johnson said, "I always welcome suggestions", stating that he would not enter into an election deal with Farage because he might run the risk of Labor Party leader Jeremy Corbyn.
"The problem here is that his (Corbyn's) plan for election is fundamentally more skeptical," said Johnson. He also rejected talks on the UK National Health Service during a trade deal with the US.
US President Donald Trump said Thursday that the alliance between Johnson and Farage would be great. He also voiced concern about Corbyn's likely run-off in the nation's December 5 election.
Trump made the comment after Farage told Johnson to either join the alliance with him in the general election and renounce the approval of the deal, or fight for it in every single seat in parliament.
In a Twitter message Friday, Johnson announced the start of his campaign, saying, "What we have achieved is a great deal that no one thought we could reach. We can reach an agreement as soon as we go back to mid-December. "
Johnson's bid to withdraw his country from the European Union failed on Oct. 6, forcing him to demand that Brussels extend the deadline for implementation. Johnson, in turn, called for early general elections in the United Kingdom so that he could gain the votes needed to approve an agreement with Brussels on how to leave the EU by changing the cabinet composition.
